user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of setup_epoll_fd:
```c
static int
setup_epoll_fd (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon)
{
  int fd;

#ifndef HAVE_MESSAGES
  (void) daemon; /* Mute compiler warning. */
#endif /* ! HAVE_MESSAGES */

#ifdef USE_EPOLL_CREATE1
  fd = epoll_create1 (EPOLL_CLOEXEC);
#else  /* ! USE_EPOLL_CREATE1 */
  fd = epoll_create (MAX_EVENTS);
#endif /* ! USE_EPOLL_CREATE1 */
  if (MHD_INVALID_SOCKET == fd)
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Call to epoll_create1 failed: %s\n"),
              MHD_socket_last_strerr_ ());
#endif
    return MHD_INVALID_SOCKET;
  }
#if ! defined(USE_EPOLL_CREATE1)
  if (! MHD_socket_noninheritable_ (fd))
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Failed to set noninheritable mode on epoll FD.\n"));
#endif
  }
#endif /* ! USE_EPOLL_CREATE1 */
  return fd;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function setup_epoll_fd:
void
MHD_DLOG (const struct MHD_Daemon *daemon,
          const char *format,
          ...)
{
  va_list va;

  if (0 == (daemon->options & MHD_USE_ERROR_LOG))
    return;
  va_start (va, format);
  daemon->custom_error_log (daemon->custom_error_log_cls,
                            format,
                            va);
  va_end (va);
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I examined every place the parameter 'daemon' appears: the (void) daemon; cast, and the calls that pass daemon to MHD_DLOG. The (void) cast does not modify the parameter. The calls pass the pointer (and MHD_DLOG takes a const pointer), and the implementation of MHD_DLOG only reads fields (daemon->options, daemon->custom_error_log, daemon->custom_error_log_cls) and does not assign to the daemon parameter or reassign the pointer. No statement in setup_epoll_fd reassigns the parameter (no "daemon = ..." or similar), and there are no modifications to the pointer variable itself. Therefore there are no code fragments that violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 in the provided code.
